intro: Hesperothamnus grandis, commonly known as the large thorned shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, which are often covered in small, sharp spines. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and typically have a bluish-green hue. Hesperothamnus grandis produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or reddish in color, blooming in the spring and early summer.
